episode_summary: This episode features discussions on unique libraries where you can borrow people, the legality of trout tickling in the UK, the challenges of food supply in Antarctica, and a dramatic story of a pilot being sucked out of a plane window.

facts.fact: You can borrow a person from the Lismore library in Australia.
It's illegal in the UK to tickle a trout.
All of the cheese eaten on Antarctica is past its expiration date.
In 1990, a British Airways flight landed with one pilot in the cockpit and the other hanging by his legs outside the front window.
